result.execSummary:
The defendant James William Clymer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by 10-28-2016 or entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed.
with credit for 45 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James William Clymer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentences defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction with credit for 45 (forty-five) days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by 10-28-16 or entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed.

Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant James William Clymer in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
Justice Point Program report dated October 27, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant James William Clymer in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties not ready to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.
Also, Atty. Williams' last day with the PD's office is tomorrow.
Statements made.
Case adjourned to 10-28-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 37, Judge Dee's Court for Status of Counsel.
Justice Point Program report dated September 9, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant James William Clymer in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested an adjournment to finalize negotiations.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant James William Clymer in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defendant informs the Court that there should be no Jr. suffix to his name, will remove.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Program report dated June 18, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James William Clymer in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant James William Clymer in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
